Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; added red band lined in white; exterior: interlinked lotus buds above band; below rays.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burnt during the bombings in London in 1941 during WWII.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0219) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 49 (Other Accession Number)
